snippet: Allowing employers to duck the birth control insurance mandate would violate the establishment clause, which enforces the separation of church and state.
abstract: Editorial argues Constitution's establishment clause may be Justice Department's strongest argument against corporations whose owners want religious exemption from providing contraception to employees under health care law; says clause, which enforces separation of church and state, takes precedence over Religious Freedom Restoration Act of 1993 and prevents employers from invoking act to force religious beliefs onto employees.
lead_paragraph: Allowing employers to duck the birth control insurance mandate would violate the establishment clause, which enforces the separation of church and state.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
